content:
There have been other reports of not being able to send to lists unless the list is expanded:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1470673

I cannot duplicate this, and am able to send to a list in the usual way. I enter the sending address in the To box and enter the list in the Bcc box: test list <test list>. I also did it as in your picture, sending from a gmail account and just entering the list in the To box. In both cases, the messages are sent and received without errors.

To diagnose the issue, I suggest you run TB in safe/troubleshoot mode, and if the problem remains, test with a new profile created from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles.
creator: sfhowes

content:
I suspect you have multiple accounts, but they aren't set up correctly with separate smtp servers. This is especially confusing with gmail accounts that automatically switch the sending account based on the smtp that is (incorrectly) selected:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1438310

content:
This has been solved by Ghot/das10 in the UK.

/* Write Window Contacts Panel. Write New Message Window: address background-color & color AND hover background-color & color*/

/* hover */

  1. abResultsTree tbody tr:hover {

background-color: #66CDAA  !important; color: black  !important; /* text color if req'd */ outline-offset: -0px  !important; outline: 0px solid #000000 !important; }

/* selected */

  1. abResultsTree tbody tr:is(.current,.selected) {

background-color: #52aaff  !important; color: black  !important; /* text color if req'd */ outline-offset: -0px  !important; outline: 0px solid #000000 !important; }

content:
"Globálna schránka prijatej pošty" umožňuje prijímať poštu z viacerých účtov jedine s POP prístupom do jednej schránky v lokálnych priečinkoch.

Váš email daliborpolanský gmail com používa IMAP prístup k pošte - ten musí mať samostatnú (vlastnú) štruktúru. Každý IMAP účet bude mať svoju skupinu priečinkov, vrátane priečinka prijatej pošty. Takže pre IMAP účty nemožno použiť "Globálnu schránku prijatej pošty"

content: First, I suggest you keep VPN turned off until everything is working. Next, be sure you accept cookies at settings>privacy&security Then, I suggest doing one account and report status. I always recommend NOT including password during initial setup. That lets you know that thunderbird found the basic account information. Wait until prompted for password to enter it. Once everything is working, I recommend doing a backup of profile when thunderbird isn't running.
creator: davidsk

content:
One of your pictures shows port 585 for the incoming GMX IMAP. It should be 993. Also, use 'normal password' authentication, not 'Encrypted password', and use the account password, not an app password.

https://support.gmx.com/pop-imap/imap/server.html

Besides the VPN, your antivirus might be blocking setup if it's not the built-in Windows Security. Run Windows in safe mode to bypass interfering startup apps, then add the accounts.

For a stny.rr.com account, use the manual config. with these settings:

incoming mail.twc.com, 993, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address

outgoing mail.twc.com, 587, STARTTLS, normal password, email address

creator: sfhowes

content:
okay, here are some thoughts: - on the first issue, in first column select FROM, in second column select CONTAINS and in third column enter amazon.co.uk - for the other issues, filters are executed in sequence, so set the first school-related filter for SUBJECT CONTAINS School Payment Receipts' and move to desired folder - now, the next filter can look for FROM and CONTAINS info@school.co.uk and move to the other folder.

If you have problems, please post screenshot of the filter itself. A reminder: spelling and character placement are critical. Use only the minimum words for success. For example, if there are never receipts other than school payment receipts, it may be safer to just look for receipts instead of school payment receipts. Just my two cents...
creator: davidsk

creator: @next

content:
First, the msf file is just an index and not needed. Thunderbird will rebuild as soon as it opens the message file. The easy way, if you're comfortable with Windows File Explorer, is this:

  1. exit thunderbird if running
  2. copy the message file to the Mail\Local Folders folder in the profile
  3. restart thunderbird

If you do not know where the profile is then

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down left side to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  3. exit thunderbird, you are now in the profile and the Mail folder will be visible. Click that and then click 'Local Folders' and copy your message files there,
creator: davidsk

content:
Prova a fare un po' di manutenzione dell'archivio: 1) Fai un backup del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo 2) Compatta le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle 3) Ricostruisci l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale

Assicurati inoltre che un eventuale antivirus di terze parti non stia interferendo con il funzionamento di Thunderbird.

content: Thunderbird is a free product, relying solely on donations, of which we receive from only approx 1% of users. That translates to no staff responding via phone. This forum is your best bet, so please explain your issue, include all error messages in full, and if the issue relates to account connection, seeing screenshots of incoming and outgoing server settings may help. Thanks.

content: Select the attachment, then press Enter to open the file with the associated default app. Picture and text attachments are opened automatically if View/Display Attachments Inline is enabled.
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
Select the attachment, then press Enter to open the file with the associated default app. Picture and text attachments are opened automatically if View/Display Attachments Inline is enabled.

No, I'm not referring to saving the file or viewing it in the program associated with the file type. I'm referring to the MacOS "Quick Look" feature where you simply press the spacebar to preview the file.
creator: braindead3xl

content:
The method I described opens the file from a temporary directory, at least on Windows. The file is not saved unless done so manually.

There is no such thing as a 'preview' of a message or attachment. If any part of it has been viewed, it has been opened. It's not like a video that can be partially viewed while it's downloading.

content: Can you add, delete or edit a contact, manually, in Address Book that is retained between TB restarts? If you can't, this indicates a corrupted address book, for which there is a remedy.
creator: sfhowes

content:
An older but fairly complete list: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Mail_and_news_settings

I would recommend creating a new profile, from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles, add the accounts, and copy local mail and address books from the old profile to the new. I do this with every major annual update, and avoid the issues caused by obsolete settings and files. Also install new annual updates in a separate location so the previous version and profile is unaffected.
creator: sfhowes
